intro: Hieracium danicum, commonly known as the Danube hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are lanceolate and hairy. Its flowers bloom in late summer, producing yellow disc florets surrounded by pale yellow to white ray florets. Hieracium danicum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
